title: Ten questions about the hard limits of human intelligence
Aerospace Engineers, Aviation Professionals- let me know what you think
text: Hi All! Our startup is pivoting into a space (what a pun) that we have struggled with ourselves.. Aerospace. I dropped out of my Space Eng PhD after struggling to find opportunities in my area, and we're hoping to change that. If you love space, are studying something to do with space/aviation, want to pursue a career in it one day, or are already working in the industry - please comment some of the challenges you have found within the industry! Anything from finding jobs, meeting requirements, seeking out opportunities.

Tell HN: My phone just told me to check for moisture in the USB port
text:
I just spilled some tea on my phone (a Samsung Galaxy S9), and it popped up a notification telling me to check and make sure the USB port is dry before charging.

I didn't know phones did this nowadays. I wanted to share it with HN in case anyone else is surprised by it.

Ask HN: Math and Theoretical CS Journals/Periodicals for High School Students?
text:
Are there any journals/periodicals in math and theoretical computer science where high school students can publish their work?

My son who has entered grade-11, has gotten deeply fascinated and involved in math and theoretical computer science, spanning areas like number theory, math of cryptography, galois field theory, and category theory after attending some well recognized math camps over the last 2 years.

He thinks there are some alternative interesting proofs for some of the theorems he's worked on. They're not new things that can be published in regular math journals, but just other ways of proving known stuff. Is there a math/cs focused publication that might encourage such articles?

Thank you!

Ask HN: What are your top open source repo management practices/tools?
text: I realized that there is no good consensus on this topic. Genuinely, interested in understanding if there are playbooks/"lessons learned"/great tools for automation to maintain and manage repos. For context, I am considering maintaining a lean python repo for the first time and weirdly not that many helpful guides around.
